description:
Each time I try to save it fails with this message:
"Save failed. Please save in your home directory". And whatever I give it as path in the GUI or even if I change the cnfig file:
~/.config/deepin/deepin-screenshot.conf
it doesn't help.
I just uninstalled it, though I found the concept very handy.
Seems needs finishing or better messaging. A screenshot shoud be intuitive.
Assigning a global keyboard for taking screenshots doesn't work. Can't change the default save folder.
summary: Works on a basic level on Kubuntu

description: Works as expected, has a few extra features (ex. drawing on screenshot) that is nice. Looks nice as well.
Not working in Wayland.

This is the software that I was waiting for more then 2 year to be available on Ubuntu mate.

Its really good. I give 5 stars to this!!!.

Suggestion to product team of "Deepin Screen Shot": There should be an option to make a folder as default folder to save all the screen shots. That way I can directly access that specific folder every time I need the screen shot rather showing option to pick the folder every time I need to save the Screen shot. And you guys are rocking
summary: Dam good one for taking and editing Screen Shots on Ubuntu mate

description:
I was always using more than one tool for screenshots, and I was missing windows only because of a good tool for that.
Now my problem is solved with this tool forever. 
Thanks Deepin team
awesome app,just like QQ in windows.

In a multi-monitor setup, it will "lock" to a single monitor (whichever monitor your mouse is on at the time you run Deepin screenshot), and you can only take a screenshot within that one monitor.

This means you cannot take a screenshot spanning multiple screens, launch Deepin screenshot and capture something on another monitor and you cannot add a shortcut/favourite to your primary gnome monitor unless the thing youre trying to screenshot is also on the primary monitor.

I spend 90% of my screenshot capturing time in a multi-monitor setup so this application is not for me. Works very well if you only have one screen though.
summary: Does not work well in a multi-monitor setup

description:
excellent, comfortable.
works on ubuntu 18
Best option to screen shot!
Great product, much better than the system-build-in screenshot software. And I use Control + Alt + a to run the command deepin-screenshot to photo my screen.
Turns the screen into garbage, screenshots these broken textures as well. I will just use flameshot, I guess
summary: Seems that there's no support for wayland

it has many functions for me.
When I open the sogtware, its crashes. FEDORA 31

description:
minimalistic but functional

Love it!

Perfect screenshot tool on paper, with functions one can desire, like quick edits and save to clipboard, but it does not save the files! Whatever the option selected, clipboard, save to selected folder, save to desktop ... They all either give an error message about the saving being a failure, or simply do not actually save the file ... Disappointing, would be perfect if it worked.

description: Deepin screenshot worked smootly in linux mint. But in ubuntu I am facing issues with copy to clipboard functionality. It gives message that successfully copied to clipboard, but when pasted in office writer it pastes nothing.
Dont PasteDont Paste

I've been using Lightshot on my old Windows for years, and since I couldn't install it on Linux, this is a great replacement for it. It only doesn't have a built-in "search on Google" upload feature that Lightshot does, but that's too much to expect.

Put it into tray, click, select an area, make quick edits on the fly (if need be) and that's it.

unable to paste in Ubuntu 20.04.2.
alternatively i can save to desktop then i can send.

I've been using Lightshot on a PC and mac for years and I've been looking for a very basic, light-weight, screenshot and markup app. This is the best I've found so far. Works great. I do wish it would dim the rest of the screen when I move to take the shot and only leave what I'm taking a picture of at full brightness.
